title: A Number Field Analogue of Ramanujan's identity for $\zeta(2m+1)$
abstract:
Ramanujan's famous formula for $\zeta(2m+1)$ has captivated the attention of
numerous mathematicians over the years. Grosswald, in 1972, found a simple
extension of Ramanujan's formula which in turn gives transformation formula for
Eisenstein series over the full modular group. Recently, Banerjee, Gupta and
Kumar found a number field analogue of Ramanujan's formula. In this paper, we
present a new number field analogue of the Ramanujan-Grosswald formula for
$\zeta(2m+1)$ by obtaining a formula for Dedekind zeta function at odd
arguments. We also obtain a number field analogue of an identity of
Chandrasekharan and Narasimhan, which played a crucial role in proving our main
identity. As an application, we generalize transformation formula for
Eisenstein series $G_{2k}(z)$ and Dedekind eta function $\eta(z)$. A new
formula for the class number of a totally real number field is also obtained,
which provides a connection with the Kronceker's limit formula for the Dedekind
zeta function.
